intro: Botryodendrum angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf botryodendrum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and for horticultural purposes.
